Title: Graystone's Torment Basic Rules

Author: Johnus of Doe

Graystone's Torment is a card game for 2-6 players centred on tormenting your fellow with Torment cards. Once someone has played all of their card they have won the game.


In Graystone's Torment every player gets drawn 7 cards which they will place in their hand out of sight of other contestants.

The remaining cards will be put on the table, this is called the draw pile. Take a card off the top of the draw pile and lie it face up on the table.


A turn consists of playing a card or drawing a card if you cannot lay one down. After drawing a card your turn is over. 

When playing a card lie it face up on the table and put the card that was originally on the table under the draw pile.


You can play a card if it is of the same type or has the same number. For example: a 9 of spades can be played of a 9 of hearts, a 4 of clubs can be played on a 10 of clubs.


--------------------------------------

In Graystone's Torment there are five Torment cards, these consist of:


The two - The next player must draw 2 cards or put down another two so the person after them has to draw 4. This is stackable.


The seven - You can play another card. This is stackable.


The eight - Skip the next persons' turn.


The jack - Change the type of card to another. For example if the jack played was a clubs and the player says hearts the next card put down has to be a hearts.


The ace - Spin the direction of the turns. The person that has went before you is now on turn.

--------------------------------------


A player cannot end the game with a Torment card.

A player must call out 'last card' when on their last card. Otherwise they have to draw a card
